translation.aboutCovidDescription: Sound advice and reliable information can be found on the covid.is website.
translation.changeLocationDescriptionIOS: It's very important to allow the app to track your location. Please change location sharing setting to <0>“Always“</0>.
translation.enableLocationServicesDescription: Location services are disabled on your phone. Tap the button to open settings where you can turn them on again.
translation.enableLocationDescriptionAndroid: The app will request permission to record your movements/location data. During this process, it is very important to select the option <0>“Allow all the time”</0>.
translation.enableLocationDescriptionIOS:
Location services must be turned on if you want to be able to provide the contact-tracing team with your location data. 
 Choose <0>“Allow while using app”</0>.
translation.enableLocationMessageIOS: After you have finished setting up the app, it will ask for saving location tracking data to your device. It is important to choose <0>“Change to Always Allow”</0>. It is necessary for the app to help the team track possible COVID-19 cases.
translation.enableNotificationDescription: The app will also request permission to send you notifications, for example if the tracing team requests your tracking data.
translation.genericErrorMessage: Oops! Something went wrong. Please try again.
translation.incorrentPINMessage: Oops! Incorrect code. Please try again.
translation.languageDescription: Help the Civil Protection Team to track potential COVID-19 infections in Iceland
translation.phoneNumberDescription: You will then be sent a code, which you will enter in the next step.
translation.pinNumberDescription: Enter the code sent to you by text message (SMS) to phone number {{phoneNumber}}.
translation.pinPhone: We'll send a verification code to {{phoneNumber}}.
translation.requestDataKennitalaInfo: Please enter your national ID number before you send your location data.
translation.requestDataSubTitle: The Department of Civil Protection and Emergency Management’s Contact Tracing Team requests that you submit your location data to assist in locating people who may be infected.
translation.requestDataThanks: Thank you for sending you data to the Department of Civil Protection and Emergency Management!
translation.requestDataWrongKennitala: The National ID number does not match the National ID number that the Tracing Team has on file.
translation.requestDataExitDescription: By selecting Yes, you will not send the requested data. To help the contain and trace COVID-19, please consider selecting No and send your data.
translation.requestDataExit: I don't want to send my data.
translation.tosAcceptance: I agree to the app's <1>Privacy Policy</1> and that location data will be stored on the phone.
translation.trackingNotification: This notification is needed to continue tracing in the background.
translation.uninstallAppToast: To stop tracking, simply uninstall the app from your device.
translation.welcomeHowDescription: The app saves your movements/locations data and stores them securely in your device. In certain instances, the Contact Tracing Team may send you a notification and request that you forward them the data. Then you can send the data to the Team with a single click. This will make it easier to trace the spread of COVID-19 while the epidemic is ongoing.
translation.welcomeHowTitle: How does the app work, and what information does it store?
translation.welcomeInfoDescription: Only your telephone number is stored in the centralised database; no other information is sent there.
translation.welcomeInfoTitle: Your device stores your location data for the past 14 days. Older data are deleted automatically.
translation.welcomeSubtitle: Let’s help the Department of Civil Protection and Emergency Management’s Contact Tracing Team to trace potential COVID-19 contagion paths in Iceland.

onboarding-1.title: The app can track your locations
onboarding-1.description: You can turn tracking off at any time. All data is saved on yourphone and not shared unless you allow it. Tracking your locations in Iceland will help the team trace whom you may have been in contact with, in case you are diagnosed with COVID-19.

onboarding-2.title: Health Protection Team asks for your locations
onboarding-2.description: Location data is saved only on your phone, and no one has access to it there. If the contact-tracing team needs your assistance, you will receive a request from the team, asking you to share your data. If you agree, your data will be stored for 14 days in the tracing team’s database.

onboarding-3.title: Your COVID-19 test result
onboarding-3.description: You will receive a notification on your COVID-19 test results in the app.

onboarding-4.title: Get direct communication to health officials
onboarding-4.description: You can contact registered health officials through the app if you experience any health related symptoms.

translation.symptomsCardSubtitle: Do you have any symptoms? Connect with live chat, important phone numbers.
translation.symptomsSubtitle: If you think you have any symptoms please take following action.
translation.informationForTouristCardSubtitle: Here you will find important information for tourists travelling in Iceland
translation.liveChatDescription: Tap here to start live chat with health officials. Put your name in field labeled "Nafn" and email in field labeled "Netfang" and click on "Byrja spjall"
translation.questionsCardSubtitle: Do you have any questions regarding the pandemic in Iceland? Click here to view frequently asked questions on covid.is
translation.questionsSubtitle: Important information about COVID-19 and most common questions answered on covid.is
translation.clinicsListSubtitle: List of nearby medical clinics according to your location
translation.helplineTitle: Red Cross helpline and online chat 1717 and raudikrossinn.is
helplineBullets: Everyone has the right to life without violence.
Bjarkarhlíð – Reykjavík. Family justice centre for survivors of violence tel:553 3000
Bjarmahlíð – Akureyri. Family justice centre for survivors of violence tel:551 2520
translation.testResultsModalTitle: You have not been diagnosed with COVID-19
translation.testResultsModalDescription: Stay save and take precautionary measures to protect yourself and others, such as frequent handwashing, use of disinfectants, the two-meter social distancing guidelines, and to respect health safety regulations in place. PCR tests do not absolutely rule out COVID-19 infection in asymptomatic individuals.
